channel.title: Comments on: A couple of ways of getting the top 2 distinct values from a set in SQL Server
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Raj
item.dc:creator: Raj
item.description: Good article Denis, Nice to see the comparison results.
item.content:encoded: Good article Denis, Nice to see the comparison results.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Niikola, you wouldn’t be able to use top 5 because in reality you wouldn’t know if the top 2 distinct would be top 2, top 5, top 10 etc

Filling up the table with 10000 values or so might give different plans, also statistics io and time would be a better metric to check against, I leave that exercise up to the reader ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: niikola
item.dc:creator: niikola
item.description: It would be interesting to see cpu time from execution as Select top 5 returns exactly the same query cost as dense ranks. Unfortunately for all the queries cpu time is 0
item.content:encoded: It would be interesting to see cpu time from execution as Select top 5 returns exactly the same query cost as dense ranks. Unfortunately for all the queries cpu time is 0
